intro: Minuartia krascheninnikovii, commonly known as Krascheninnikov's sandflower, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils with poor nutrients. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats. Its morphology reflects evolutionary adaptations to cold climates and limited water availability.
